tweet_text: The monumental task before President-Elect Joe Biden and Vice President-Elect Kamala Harris to unify our nation in this great time of reckoning and divide will not be easy to overcome. But I look forward to working with each to stand up for the people of Alabama‚Äôs 7th District.

name: Rep. Terri A. Sewell
tweet_text:
I remain committed to doing everything in my power to ensuring every Black woman has equal access to quality maternal healthcare.

CC: @RepUnderwood, @RepRobinKelly, @SenKamalaHarris

name: Rep. Terri A. Sewell
tweet_text: This pandemic has only heightened this crisis affecting Black women, especially in Alabama, which has some of the highest rates of maternal mortality in the nation. To put it in perspective: Black women are up to 3 times as likely to die in childbirth than white women.

name: Rep. Terri A. Sewell
tweet_text:
As a member of the Black Maternal Health Caucus, I am urgently renewing my call to pass the Black Maternal Health Momnibus Act, a bill that would make critically important investments to support our families, moms and babies.

https://t.co/hhow9Qtq6O

name: Rep. Terri A. Sewell
tweet_text: We cannot let Dr. Chaniece Wallace's death be in vain. Pre-eclampsia is thought to be one of the most preventable pregnancy complications, but rates are higher, and the prognosis worse, among Black women. We must make childbirth SAFE for Black women!

name: Rep. Terri A. Sewell
tweet_text:
Sending my deepest thoughts and prayers to the family of Dr. Chaniece Wallace. Wallace touched the lives of so many across Alabama. She was an Alabama native and a graduate of UAB School of Medicine. This is devastating news.

https://t.co/wXnf8xOC36

name: Rep. Terri A. Sewell
tweet_text: As COVID-19 cases continue to rise, it‚Äôs clear more than ever: The American people need relief NOW! We are still in deep economic turmoil. It's incumbent on the White House and Senate Republicans to pass the updated #HeroesAct that languishes on @senatemajldr's desk.

name: Rep. Terri A. Sewell
tweet_text: While we are seeing some growth this quarter, it is unsteady and unequal. Families in Alabama continue to struggle under challenging economic conditions, and this weak economy will continue until we have a national strategy and plan to control the spread of the coronavirus.

name: Rep. Terri A. Sewell
tweet_text:

tweet_text: Fairness and comity demand that the Senate not confirm any vacancy on the Supreme Court until the American people have chosen the next president. To do otherwise, I believe would undermine the very legitimacy of the Supreme Court.

name: Rep. Terri A. Sewell
tweet_text: This standard articulated by Senate Republicans was applied against President Obama‚Äôs nomination of Judge Merrick Garland eight months before the 2016 presidential election.

tweet_text: The nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett is clearly tainted by the hypocrisy of Senate Republicans to go back on their own promise not to fill a vacancy on the Supreme Court so close to a presidential election.
